snippet: Five journalists have died so far this year in Pakistan, and by some accounts, the dangers of reporting in the nation have been intensifying.
abstract: Committee to Protect Journalists reports that five journalists have died so far in 2013 in Pakistan, and by some accounts, dangers of reporting there have been intensifying; many others have been kidnapped, beaten or otherwise intimidated because of their work; attackers are not just insurgents and criminals but also operatives from Pakistan’s civilian and military intelligence agencies.
lead_paragraph: Five journalists have died so far this year in Pakistan, and by some accounts, the dangers of reporting in the nation have been intensifying.

headline.main: Danger Persists for Reporters in Pakistan, Despite Vow to Protect Them
headline.print_headline: Danger Persists for Reporters in Pakistan, Despite Vow to Protect Them
